header_summary:
Christopher Allen highlights Blockchain Commons' efforts to integrate FROST signing with Bitcoin transactions, enhancing resilience and efficiency in multisignature processes, with a demonstration scheduled for the Gordian meeting. This initiative underscores the necessity for community input to address architectural, security, and privacy challenges in integrating FROST with Bitcoin's Taproot, alongside showcasing FROST CLI tools for developer engagement. Blockchain Commons also plans to extend their educational resources to include FROST and BDK technologies, aiming for broader developer adoption and practical experimentation [source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CACrqygC5925FrJ5WN=986Bni5+0zZ7YeC_EqAXyao=u5rK3P_A@mail.gmail.com/T/#u#m9cde5186fa3252c00d5051a72924b5931f416660).

Murch addresses the impracticality of indefinitely retaining data on unconfirmed Bitcoin transactions, emphasizing the significance of confirmed transactions to the network's shared state and suggesting Bitcoin Stack Exchange as a more suitable platform for detailed technical discussions on this topic [source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/b7f915b6-a4a4-4c8d-811a-70cfdb761565@murch.one/T/#m75e3427b3a1f5502407c7fb0c65f3fbf6f459b07).

Gloria Zhao announces the release of Bitcoin Core version v29.1rc1, encouraging community participation in testing to identify critical issues before the final release. This version, available for download with preliminary release notes, reflects the developers' commitment to leveraging user feedback for refining the software, highlighting the collaborative nature of Bitcoin's development process [source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/bfd8ef74-3519-4da9-a9cc-3f5758d6d845n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#m714a61e394d2b8cff4fd01d8d5e6d703e9cbebd9).

The discussions on non-standard Bitcoin transactions by 1440000bytes and the debate on network decentralization raised by davidtaubmann reflect the ongoing discourse within the cryptocurrency community on evolving transaction standards and the challenges of maintaining decentralization amidst increasing institutional involvement. These conversations underscore the dynamic and complex nature of Bitcoin's development and the broader cryptocurrency ecosystem [source 1](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/changing-the-minimum-relay-feerate/1886/3), [source 2](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/paralel-bitcoin-only-for-conscious-living-individuals/1877/13).

recent_posts.title: [ann] FROST Signing for Bitcoin: Demo + Taproot Integration Discussion @ Aug 6 Gordian Call
recent_posts.summary:
- Blockchain Commons integrates FROST with Bitcoin, enhancing resilience and multisignature efficiency.
- Gordian meeting to explore FROST signatures with Taproot, focusing on necessary adjustments.
- Educational initiatives aim to broaden FROST and BDK technology adoption among developers.

recent_posts.title: Proposal: Self-Verifiable Transaction Broadcast Log for Enhanced User Transparency
recent_posts.summary:
- Keeping unconfirmed transaction information indefinitely is questioned for utility and practicality.
- Nodes might track unconfirmed transactions, but their permanence is seen as unnecessary.
- Discussing these technical aspects may be more suitable on dedicated Bitcoin forums.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 29.1 release candidate available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core v29.1rc1 binaries are now available for download, marking a key development step.
- This release candidate version invites user testing to identify any critical issues before final release.
- Community feedback on this version is crucial and can be reported through GitHub's issue tracker.

recent_posts.title: Changing the minimum relay feerate
recent_posts.summary:
- Non-standard Bitcoin transactions could evolve, challenging current network rules and limitations.
- Miners might reshape Bitcoin by confirming free or Segwit-enabled transactions up to 4MB.
- Discussions about reevaluating transaction standardness lack a consensus, despite practical implications.

recent_posts.title: Paralel Bitcoin only for conscious living individuals
recent_posts.summary:
- The concern highlights Bitcoin's decentralization issue and its control by Western oligarchies.
- It argues that financial elites and possibly Satoshi Nakamoto benefit from Bitcoin's market movements.
- The piece suggests a Bitcoin fork excluding institutions is essential for true decentralization.

recent_posts.title: Fingerprinting nodes via addr requests
recent_posts.summary:
- Discussions focus on enhancing privacy by modifying timestamp usage in network operations.
- Strategies include changing `nTime` usage and addressing `ADDR` message format issues.
- Concerns involve potential impacts on network diversity and the effectiveness of anti-fingerprinting measures.

active_posts.title: A Taproot-native (re-)bindable transaction bundle proposal
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Poinsot, Steven Roose, and Greg Sanders proposed enhancing Bitcoin with three key functionalities.
- They introduced `OP_TEMPLATEHASH` as a modern, Taproot-native alternative to `OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY`.
- The proposal aims for efficiency and simplicity, avoiding changes to legacy Script and bare CTV.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Utreexo Nodes
active_posts.summary:
- Tadge Dryja, Davidson Souza, and Calvin Kim introduced three proposals to improve Bitcoin.
- Their focus is on Utreexo for efficient transaction verification without full UTXO storage.
- They seek community feedback on GitHub to refine these Bitcoin Improvement Proposals.

active_posts.title: Taproot is post-quantum secure when restricted to script-path spends
active_posts.summary:
- A study finds Bitcoin's Taproot secure against quantum attacks under certain conditions.
- It suggests a two-phase softfork for enhancing Bitcoin's post-quantum security.
- Quantum computing is less concerning than classical computing for Taproot's security.

active_posts.title: Changes to BIP-360 - Pay to Quantum Resistant Hash (P2QRH)
active_posts.summary:
- Recent BIP-360 updates enhance Bitcoin's defense against quantum threats through P2QRH and Taproot modifications.
- The strategy avoids emergency measures by providing time for adaptation ahead of potential quantum attacks.
- Future provisions for Post-Quantum signatures in BIP-360 introduce a flexible framework and promote ongoing protocol robustness.

active_posts.title: A simple backup scheme for wallet accounts
active_posts.summary:
- Josh's method is distinguished by unique inscription and location features.
- The proposal suggests standardizing Salvatore's method before adding Josh's unique aspects.
- Combining both methods aims to create a comprehensive solution with standardized and innovative elements.

active_posts.title: Exploring Extended Relative Timelocks
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion explores extending Bitcoin's timelock to ~10 years, driven by user feedback.
- A solution proposes using bit 21 in `nSequence` for longer timelocks, facilitating an 8x duration increase.
- The initiative includes creating a tool and code for experimentation, alongside examining risks and alternatives.

today_in_history_posts.title: On a new community process to specify covenants
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposed a decentralized investigation process on the bitcoin-dev mailing list.
- The process includes IRC discussions, in-person meetups, and goes through six defined phases.
- Results will be shared for broader feedback, aiming to narrow proposals to one or two main focuses.

today_in_history_posts.title: Splice Pinning Prevention w/o Anchors
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Anchor outputs mitigate mempool pinning by enforcing specific scripting rules.
- Splice transactions require v0 P2SH witness scripts with `1 CSV` timelock for security.
- Arbitrary spliced outputs go into a fan-out transaction to ensure protocol compliance.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bolt 12 enhances lightning wallets by enabling payments with metadata, prioritizing user experience.
- It proposes selective identity revelation via `contact_key` distribution and mutual authentication for privacy.
- The initiative seeks community feedback to refine bLIP 42, aiming for a consensus on privacy and user experience standards.
